Factory-made clothing and premade foods have eroded their roles, leaving women like Mang without a clear role to contribute to the family. 

Hammock weaving created a new opportunity for Mang to earn her own income and continue to contribute to the extended family's household she lives in.  Hammock weaving has made her a financial leader among her relatives!  This loan will help Mang provide for herself, manage her finances and enjoy a home-based job that allows her to work on her own schedule and spend time with family.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials so she can secure consistent weaving work and increase her income potential.

loans.name: Maow

texts.en:
Maow grew up in a larger Hmong village about an hour away from Huay Hom Village, but as a young woman she took refuge in Huay Hom during a family crisis.  It has been nearly 20 years since she left her family home and came to live in a strange new place among more distant relatives.  For the first 10 years, she earned a meager living working in the fields.  She scraped by, but disaster struck when Maow lost the use of her arm and became unable to perform agricultural work.  Maow’s livelihood and independence were threatened and she feared becoming a burden on her relatives.

Luckily, hammock weaving provided a perfect opportunity for Maow.  Her eye for details and experience with traditional textile weaving made it easy for her to become a prolific and versatile weaver.  Within just a few short months, she mastered every hammock weave!  Now Maow is a trainer for new weavers and an expert at repairing hammocks damaged by less experienced weavers.  She is relieved to have an ongoing, stable source of income that keeps her from burdening her family.  With this loan, she will be able to take control of her annual income and better balance her mentoring duties with her own hammock production, gaining even more independence.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials so she can secure consistent weaving work and increase her income potential.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, tiene 55 años, vive en casa propia, junto a sus hijos cultiva granos básicos (maíz y frijol) para llevar ingresos a su hogar. Aprendió a trabajar con sus padres desde que estaba pequeña y  hace 20 años lo hace con sus hijos; trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 12: p.m. Con el préstamo ella comprara abono, fertilizantes y semilla para sembrar, on lo cual ella aumentara sus ingresos y la productividad.
Su deseo es seguir trabajando por mejorar su economía y brindarles una condición de vida mucho mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Juana is 55 years old. She lives in her own house with her children. She grows basic grains (corn and beans) to bring in household income. She learned to work with her parents when she was young. For 20 years, she has done the same with her children. They work from Monday to Saturday, from 6 a.m. to 12 p.m. With the loan, she will purchase fertilizers and seeds to plant. She will increase her profits and productivity. Her wish is to continue working to improve her income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Don Cristino de 49 años, logro estudiar segundo año de educación básica, manifiesta  que en su época de niñez y juventud era muy difícil el poder estudiar. Esta acompañado, su señora se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño negocio(tienda). Sus tres hijos mayores, ya tienen su propia familia, la hija que vive con él, esta estudiando. De él dependen su esposa  y su hija.

Él es empleado en la alcaldía, desde hace 12 años, como seguridad municipal y también le ayuda a atender el negocio familiar a su señora, debido a que en la alcaldía trabaja un día y otro día descansa.  Su trabajo esta a 10 km de su casa y viaja en bus, anteriormente se dedicaba a las actividades agrícolas.

El crédito lo necesita para ampliar el negocio familiar que tienen, invertir en la compra de mas mercadería y variada, para tener mejores ingresos, porque sus ingresos como empleado son bien bajos y no es a tiempo completo, necesita otras fuentes de ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia.


Desea que su negocio este fortalecido y que sea rentable, que pueda mantener a su familia con esta actividad y no depender tanto del salario de empleado, que es el mínimo y que no cubre las necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Cristino, 49, managed to complete second grade in elementary school. He says that in his childhood and youth it was very difficult to go to school.   He has a spouse and his wife works in commerce; she has a small store.   His three adult children have their own families and his daughter that still lives with him is studying.  His wife and daughter are dependent on him.

He’s been a city employee for 12 years; he works as a municipal security officer and also helps tend to his wife’s store because he works for the city one day on and one day off.  His job is 10 kilometers from home and he gets there by bus.  He used to work in agriculture.

He needs the loan to expand the family business they have.  He wants to buy more and more varied merchandise to increase income because his salary as an employee is quite low and not full-time; he needs other sources of income to provide family sustenance.

He wants his business to be stronger and more profitable so that he can support his family with it and not depend so much on his salary as an employee which is minimum wage and insufficient to cover basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more varied merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, chicken, fish, soft drinks, etc., for her restaurant business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 10 years.  She earns other income from a general store.

Lilibeth has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, like meat, chicken, fish, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 52 years old and married, with ten children.

Florencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods like soap, shampoo, egg, noodles, spices, bread, etc.

Florencia has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and she also earns an income from abaca weaving.

Florencia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods, like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, spices, bread, etc

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime de 29 años, es un joven que estudio  noveno grado. Es acompañado, su esposa trabaja también en la siembra de hortalizas, su hijo vive con ellos en su casa y actualmente estudia parvularia. Además, de su esposa y su hijo, también vive con ellos un hermano de Jaime. 

Jaime trabaja en la siembra de granos básicos (frijol y maíz ), tiene 16 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, aprendió de sus padres quienes siempre se interesaron a que aprendiera, desde pequeño salía muy de mañana con su padre a la parcela donde trabajan; decidió dedicarse a ello porque, cuando se acompañó no le quedó otra opción de sembrar granos para obtener su alimentación y la de su familia, recientemente ha llegado a su comunidad una institución  que les está ayudando con la asistencia técnica, para la siembra de hortalizas que es otra actividad económica que tiene. El lugar donde trabaja está a unos 500 metros de su casa y viaja a pie; su esposa es la que se involucra en el trabajo. Generalmente trabaja de 6 de la mañana a 2 de la tarde.

   El préstamo que está solicitando, es para dar una contrapartida a la institución que les facilitara parte de los materiales que necesitaran en la siembra de las hortalizas, le permitirá dar toda la cantidad de dinero que la institución les pide, así se beneficiara con los materiales y podrá sembrar más hortalizas para sacar una mayor producción.

Lo que tiene planificado, es seguir trabajando con la fundación que le sigan apoyando y obtener un monto mayor y ampliar el área donde trabaja instalándole, un sistema de riego para mejorar su producción. También pretende que su hija, alcance un nivel académico que le permita vivir en otras condiciones en las cuales el no tuvo la oportunidad de vivir.
texts.en:
Jaime, 29, is a young man who completed ninth grade.  He has a spouse and his wife also works growing vegetables.  His son lives at home and is currently in nursing school.  In addition to his wife and son one of Jaime’s brothers also lives with them.

Jaime works growing basic grains (corn and beans).  He’s been in this activity 16 years having learned from his parents who were always interested in his learning.  Ever since he was little he’d go out to the fields where his father worked.  He decided to go into the same line of work because when he married he had no other option but to grow basic grains in order to obtain food for him and his family.

An institution has recently arrived in his community that’s helping them with technical assistance to grow vegetables which is another economic activity he has.  The place he works is about 500 meters from home and he gets there on foot; his wife helps him with the work which generally goes from six in the morning to two in the afternoon.

The loan he’s asking for is to make a co-payment to the institution that’s making available some of the materials needed for the vegetable planting.  It will make it possible for him to make the entire payment the institution is requiring and he will be able to have the benefit of the materials and be able to plant more vegetables to get a higher crop yield.

His plan is to continue working with the foundation to continue getting its support and to get a larger amount to expand the area he works installing an irrigation system to improve production.  He also intends to see that his daughter attains an academic level that will allow her to live in better conditions than the ones he was able to have.

loans.use: to make a payment to his suppliers.

loans.name: Parichat

texts.en:
Parichat was born and raised in a Hmong hill-tribe family in Chiang Rai province.  When she married, she moved to her husband’s village in Phrae Province, about a 5-hour drive south of her home.

As is common with many young Hmong couples, they started out living with her husband’s family and hoped to work hard enough to afford a place of their own.  As a new member of the family, Parichat was eager to prove herself a worthy wife and productive partner.  Although Parichat earned an education and can read and write in Thai, she struggled at first to find a source of income; there are few job opportunities in her village or the surrounding area. 

Two years ago, Parichat began learning to weave hammocks.  She caught on very quickly and her ability to read helped her understand even the most complex weaving patterns without assistance.  Now she is a prolific weaver!

Although most couples in their tribe try to start families right away, Parichat and her husband are only recently expecting their first baby.  This loan will help Parichat establish her continued independence as a producer and assure them of a stable source of income as they build their new family.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials so she can secure consistent weaving work and increase her income potential.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Guatemala's Yolanda, who is part of the Nu'Kem Association of Textile Artisans, specializes in hand-woven accessories and wall hangings. They would like to invest in a bulk purchase of cotton and rayon yarn.

Yolanda and the Association have been selling through Novica since 2011. This is their story:

"In the Q'echi Maya language, Nu'Kem means 'My Loom.' The Association is a dream come true for 12 women seeking a better life. Together, they buy thread in bulk and have received training in style and design. All work on Guatemala's traditional back-strap loom to create their extraordinary textiles.

Yolanda says: "Thank you very much for this microcredit because it will enable us to purchase more yarn. We want to purchase yarn in a variety of nice and attractive colors so that you'll like what we weave."

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of cotton and rayon yarn.

loans.name: Latisha

texts.en: Latisha is 30 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small food stall in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Latisha has requested a loan to buy foam cups, plastic bags, plates, chicken, mutton flaps and cordials. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Latisha hopes to build a brighter future for her children.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, plastic bags, plates, chicken, mutton flaps, and cordials.

loans.name: Lauiula

texts.en:
Lauiula is a widow, 51 years old, and living with 8 children. She runs a small business, selling a variety of baked goodies in her community, and has been doing this for 3 years. 

Lauiula has requested a loan to buy an oven, flour, sugar, cooking oil and yeast. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lauiula will help pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy an oven, flour, sugar, cooking oil and yeast.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is single, and she has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, etc.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 36 years old and married, with three children, two of whom in school, Marjorie works very hard to provide for them.

Marjorie runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell, like soft drinks, milk, soap, canned goods, etc.

Marjorie has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Marjorie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, like soft drinks, milk, soap, canned  goods, etc

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna  works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a tricycad transport business in the Philippines.

Edna requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycad.

Edna has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Edna  would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycad

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
A $ 600 is offered to Esmerlda to improve her business. She is married and has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as water, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, fanta, coca cola, milk, fish, and biscuits. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2005. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Esmralda independent, because she can be responsible for herself and help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it's offered to poor people to improve the living condition for the future.

loans.use: to buy water, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, fanta, coca cola, milk, fish, and biscuits.

loans.name: Álvaro Enrique

texts.es: Álvaro, a sus 48 años de edad, es casado y padre de dos hijos de 12 y 17 años.  Proviene de una familia muy humilde que vivían en constante crisis económica, debido a esto tuvo que comenzar a trabajar desde que tenía 12 años, inició en el campo de la construcción y, con el paso del tiempo fue creciendo y adquiriendo mucha experiencia y conocimientos, por lo que se convirtió en maestro de obra y tenía varias personas a su cargo. Actualmente continúa desempeñándose en esta labor y ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y ha educado a sus hijos, quienes se han convertido en el motor principal de su vida. El cliente se caracteriza por ser un hombre activo, perseverante y luchador, a pesar de todas las dificultades por las que ha pasado, siempre las supera y sigue avanzando. Esto lo lleva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, con el que comprará una moto, para facilitar su traslado a diferentes poblaciones donde tiene contratos, así podrá cumplir con tiempos de entrega y disminuirá los gastos, mejorando así la rentabilidad de su negocio. Esto le permitirá aumentar los ingresos económicos con los que podrá solventar las necesidades de su hogar. De esta manera Álvaro desea seguir luchando para ser mejor cada día y brindar a sus hijos un mejor bienestar y una excelente educación, pues su sueño es verlos progresar y ser unos profesionales, para puedan forjar su propio camino de éxito y tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Álvaro, who is 48 years old, is married and the father of two children, ages 12 and 17. He comes from a very humble family that lived in a constant economic crisis. Because of this, he had to work beginning when he was 12 years old. He began to work in the construction field and, over time, he grew and acquired a lot of experience and knowledge, so he became a construction teacher and he is now in charge of many people.

He still carries out this work and has been able to bring his family forward and educate his children, who have become the driving force in his life. Álvaro describes himself as an active, persistent, and determined. Despite all the difficulties he has faced, he always overcomes them and continues to advance.

This has motivated him to request the assistance of a loan, with which he will purchase a motorcycle to facilitate his transportation to different areas where he has contracts. This way, he will be able to meet his deadlines and reduce his costs, which will improve the profitability of his business. This will allow him to increase his economic resources, with which he will be able to resolve his household's needs.

Álvaro hopes to continue fighting each day and provide his children with a better quality of life and an excellent education, since his dream is to see them progress and become professionals so that they can forge their own path of success and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to facilitate his transportation to different areas.

loans.name: La Union 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group, La Union (the union). This group consists of 20 micro-entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where Maribel makes her home in a simple structure with her two children and long-term partner. Her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children.

Maribel has sold clothing for around four years, having started the business with her own savings. Now retailing a variety of products, she is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza International, with which she will purchase clothes.

Maribel will reinvest the profits in her enterprise and save some for any family needs that may arise. She also wants to save and have a beautiful and safe home. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fe De Dios 1, 2, 3, 4 Group

texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group, called Fe de Dios (God's faith). This group is comprised of 20 micro-entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Marie makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their 4 children. She is excited to be taking out her fourth loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. 

This businesswoman runs a miscellaneous products store where she sells different products like shoes, cosmetics, clothes, and other products. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to increase her inventory by buying these products.

Marie said that her most difficult challenge has been to have a stable and prosperous business. She will use the profits to reinvest and save for her family needs. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous (cosmetics, shoes, clothes, etc).

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en: Leoniza is 31 years old, married, and has one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. Leoniza runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional household items to sell like spices, eggs, canned goods, etc. Leoniza has been in this business for one year. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell like spices, eggs, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Dúo Mensajeras De Sineyes Group

texts.es:
DUO MENSAJERAS DE SINEYES

Este lo forma doña Irma Yolanda casada, tiene 4 hijos pequeños que están estudiando y su esposo trabaja como albañil en la capital, ella se dedica a su tienda que tiene desde hace 4 años, y nos cuenta que necesita este crédito porque necesita surtir su tienda comprando algunos artículos que le hacen falta, como (maíz, frijol, arroz, aceite, golosinas y frutas que ahora le están pidiendo sus clientes, dice que con eso ayuda al sostenimiento de su hogar juntamente con su esposo y eso hace que sus hijos también se ayuden con su educación, esperando que ustedes Kiva le puedan ayudar con el credito y asi ella pueda salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Duo Mensajeras de Sineyes

Irma Yolanda is a member of this group. She is married and has four young children who are in school. Her husband works as a construction worker in the capital. She has worked in her store for the past 4 years. 

She tells us that she needs this loan because she needs to stock her store with some supplies that she is lacking, like corn, beans, rice, oil, snacks, and fruit that her clients are requesting. She also reports that this loan will help her to support her household, along with her husband, and will also allow her children to continue studying. She hopes that Kiva lenders can help her by providing her with a loan so that she can move forward with her family.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Javiel

texts.es:
Francisco de 27 años, estudio hasta 9° grado por la situación económica que enfrentaba su familia no pudo seguir estudiando. Él es casado, su esposa es empleada de seguridad, ellos solo tienen 2 hijas, una niña de 6 años y la otra de 2 años de edad.

Francisco tiene un negocio propio de estructuras metálicas, en la fabricación de puertas ventanas y verjas de metal, él se dedica  a este negocia desde hace 10 años, como sus hermanos mayores se dedicaban a este negocio, él desde pequeño aprendió a desempeñar este trabajo y vio que era una actividad que le generaría buenos ingresos a su familia. Aparte de tener el negocio,  también se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos. Su negocio lo tiene en su casa trabaja, de 7 am a 4 pm es por eso que no tiene que movilizarse para realizar su trabajo. 

  El préstamo lo utilizara para la construcción de su vivienda, en la compra de 2,000 tejas, hierro y madera para el techo de su casa. De esta manera, ellos viviran mas cómodamente con su esposa e hijas, en su nueva vivienda que desde hace tiempo tenían el deseo de construir.  

Lo que desea en el futuro, es ampliar más su negocio de estructuras metálicas y poder emplear a más personas en el trabajo con futuros créditos y tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Él desea para sus hijas, lo mejor que sean personas de bien en la sociedad, que logren terminar  sus estudios y una carrea universitaria.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 27, went to school up to the ninth grade.  Due to the financial situation that his family faced, he was not able to continue studying.  He is married, and his wife is a security employee.  They only have two children, a six year old girl and a two year old girl.

Francisco has his own business of metal structures.  He makes doors, windows, and metal grills.  He has been in this business for ten years.  As his older brothers worked in this business, he learned to do this work when he was little.  He saw that it was a business activity that would generate good income for his family.

Aside from having this business, he works in agriculture by growing basic grains.  He has his business at his house.  He works from 7:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  That is why he does not have to go to another location to do his work.

He will use the loan for construction of his house.  He will buy 2,000 shingles, iron, and wood for the roof of his house.  This way his wife and daughters and he will live more comfortably in their new house.  For some time they have wanted to build it.

What he wants in the future, with future loans, is to expand his metal structure business and to be able to employ more people at his work.  He also wants to have a better quality of life for his family.  He wishes his daughters the best.  He wishes that they become good people in society and that they manage to finish their education with a university degree.

loans.use: to buy 2,000 shingles, iron, and wood for the roof of his house.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is married and has two children and three grandchildren. He is a retired teacher who now focuses on farming; his wife has retired from banking and now engages in projects on their land.

Henry is currently farming maize, tomatoes, chili peppers (which are famous in the area for their quality) as well as a tree plantation. He says his nickname around the area is “Mr. Green” because of his lush homestead. According to Henry, “When I see a spot that is not green, I plant something new and grow it until it is green. I love to see everything green.”

Henry lives in a small town in Kwale County, which is located on the Kenyan coast and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfall makes farming difficult and contributes to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, wild mangrove forests and local passionfruit plantations provide reliable sources of nectar for bees. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives.

Henry had tried keeping bees previously, but the lack of an established market for honey stymied his efforts. When he heard that a company offering a guaranteed market for honey was in the region, he “came running to sign up.”

This is Henry’s first loan—25,000 KES—with Honey Care, and he plans to use the income generated from his beehives to help support his family, including his grandchildren, and other less fortunate children in the area.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Ying

texts.en:
Ying has worked hard throughout her long life.  Her family had a difficult time making ends meet before they moved to Huay Hom village in Phrae Province.  When they heard about the success that other members of their clan were having with a new settlement, they made the decision to move and start over in this new farming community.

Though Ying worked for many years on her family’s plot of farmland, she has reached an age where field labor is difficult for her.  Traditionally, the Hmong people value industriousness and divide all of the tribe’s labor into tasks that are appropriate for each age and station.  Older women like Ying would be responsible for home-based tasks like sewing and cooking, but an increasing reliance on factory-made clothes and pre-made foods left her without proper work. 

Hammock weaving was the perfect solution for Ying.  She can work comfortably from home, take care of family members and enter her “retirement” years feeling happy and useful.  In fact, her weaving earns so much money that she is becoming a main provider for her family!  This loan will help Ying with her financial planning and make it possible for her to control her annual income and workload without worrying about working long hours during busy periods.

loans.use: to create a stockpile of hammocks during the off season and ensure a steady flow of income throughout the year.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
A hardworking entrepreneur, Meriam is 55 years old and a widow with three children. For the past three years she has had a mobile fish vending business in the Philippines.

Meriam is applying for a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She is working to build and expand her business so as to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 37-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells fresh produce to support his family. Like most traders in this business, he is challenged by seasonality and and perishability.

James is applying for a 500,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy additional produce to sell. His dream is to educate his children up to university level and set up a modern food store.

loans.use: to buy additional produce to sell.

loans.name: Reylen

texts.en:
Reylen is 48 years old and married with two children.

Reylen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Reylen has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Reylen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam used the previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. She is a 42-year-old, hardworking, single mother, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop as well as sells fire wood and charcoal. She began the business 12 years back with the aim of educating her children and supporting her family. She has since reaped tangible benefits.

Price fluctuations is her major hardship, while her dream is to trade in whole sale and construct a good permanent residential house. Zam intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour and general merchandise, such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour and general merchandise, such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Angelly

texts.es: Angelly  de 18 años de edad, desde muy niña sintió admiración por su tía, quien practica la actividad de comerciante y le enseñó todo lo que hoy conoce sobre ventas. De la mano de su tía, inició a los 16 años, su pequeño negocio, vendiendo productos lácteos y cárnicos y posteriormente mercancía variada al detalle. Gradualmente ha ido construyendo su clientela, entre sus compañeras de estudio actual y por eso se vinculó a multinacionales, para ofrecer artículos variados, como cosméticos, ropa infantil y para damas, mediante guías especializadas de productos; su cocimiento en el mercado fue lo primeo que hizo, como ejercicio, con la tutoría de su tía, para poder avanzar; Hoy tiene como meta construir su historial creditico, y por eso es la primera vez que aplica a un crédito.  Su negocio lo desarrolla puerta a puerta, mediante la modalidad de ventas a crédito y de contado, con la frecuencia de 20 días y comprando productos directamente a los distribuidores, que lo hacen mediante catálogos. Con el fin de apoyar su inclusión financiera, Angelly hoy acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que realiza y con el cual comprará productos de belleza, ropa, femenina e infantil, carne, pescado, queso. Con su credikiva espera incrementar las ventas y aumentar el número de clientes. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local propio para exhibir productos y su mayor desafío es terminar su carrera profesional de cosmetología y aprender el idioma Inglés, como su segunda lengua.  Angelly, enfocada en su sueño de prosperidad, gradualmente logrará superar  las barreras que lo obstaculicen.
texts.en:
Angelly is 18 years old. Since she was young, she admired her aunt, who is a saleswoman and taught her everything she knows about sales. Alongside her aunt, she started her own small business at age 16, selling dairy products and meat, and later expanded to various retail merchandise. Gradually, she expanded her customers among her schoolmates, so she decided to work with multinational companies to offer a variety of merchandise, like makeup and women's and children's clothing, through specialized product guides.

Her knowledge of the market was the first thing that she practiced with her aunt's help and it allowed her to advance. Today, her goal is to build her credit history, so this is the first time that she is applying for a loan. She developed her business by going door-to-door, making sales in cash and credit with a frequency of 20 days, and purchasing products directly from distributors' catalogs. 

With the goal of improving her access to finance, Angelly has turned to a Kiva loan as her first source of financing, and with which she will purchase beauty products, women's and children's clothing, meat, fish, and cheese. With her Kiva loan, she hopes to increase her sales and number of customers. Her ultimate goal is to have her own shop where she can display products. Her greatest challenge is to finish cosmetology school and learn English as her second language. Angelly, who is focused on her dream of prosperity, will eventually overcome the obstacles in her life.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products, women's and children's clothing, meat, fish, and cheese.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 56 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Violeta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs.

Violeta has been raising pigs for ten years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 35-year-old hardworking lady with 5 children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells baby clothes and fresh foods. With the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. 

Like most traders in the business, she is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and inadequate capital, while her business plans are to set up a modern food store, educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications, and own a boutique. Violet is requesting a loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson used the previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. He is a 50-year-old married man with four children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility to sustain the family is vested on him with minimal contribution from the wife, who is a business woman. 

He has a retail shop, and has been in this business for 17 years. He still reaps tangible benefits. His challenges include bad debts and seasonal customers, and his vision is to become a wholesale trader. 

Wilson is requesting a loan to buy sugar, rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 43 years old and has three children. Victoria is married and one of her children is in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural, pig fattening, business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

Victoria has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 59 years old and widowed with eight children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, milk, canned goods, chips, etc.

She has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from a buy and sell dried coconut meat and rice grains business.

Alma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, milk, canned goods, chips, etc

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly works hard to support her family. Dolly is married, and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for nine years.

Dolly requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Alvie

texts.en:
Alvie is 32 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, rice, sugar, and other groceries.

Alvie has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from direct selling of Avon, Natasha and MSE products.

Alvie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, rice, sugar, and other groceries

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a 32-year-old, hardworking lady with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop, but is also involved in transport business in order to raise money to support her family.

Price fluctuations and high cost of fuel are her major hindrances to achieving her goals of becoming rich, while her dream is to own a wholesale shop. Lillian is requesting a loan to buy maize flour, beer, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, beer, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Avezkul

texts.ru: Авезкул 31 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Авезкул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Авезкул занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Авезкул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 бык, 4 бычка, 2 овцы, а также имеет 14,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает клевер и ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Авезкул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Авезкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на обучение своих детей.
texts.en: Avezkul is 31 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Avezkul has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, Avezkul is involved in animal husbandry, having started 8 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Avezkul's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 1 bull, 4 calves, 2 sheep and also 14 hectares of land, where she annually grows clover and barley. The monthly income amounts to 6,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Avezkul requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy sheep in order to increase livestock headcount. Avezkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 37 years old and lives in Olingan, Dipolog in the Philippines. In order to help support the family, she operates a sari-sari store.

In the past seven months Daisy has become an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She is applying for a 11,000 PHP loan to buy more goods for her sari-sari.

in the future Daisy would like to repair the family’s house and send her children to college so that they can help support the family.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her sari-sari.

loans.name: Noneluna

texts.en:
Noneluna is 56 years old and has seven children. Noneluna is married and two of her children are in school.

Noneluna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs, in the Philippines. Noneluna requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Noneluna has been raising pigs for 19 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Noneluna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 53 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell, such as soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, milk, etc.

Adelaida has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Adelaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, such as soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, milk, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Susana is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of different vegetable to sell in her vegetable vending business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of different vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lolita  has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to make and sell dried fish.

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Lolita  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.  Emma has been in this business for 18 years. Emma earns more income from raising pigs.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita is 58 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Zita runs a direct-selling personal collection products in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of soap, toothpaste, dish washing products, etc.

Zita has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soap, toothpaste, dish washing products, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, a widow, works hard to support her family. For three years now she has run a used clothing business in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of used clothes to sell.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Dúo Manzanal Ll Group

texts.es:
DUO EL MANZANAL II

El grupo está conformado por la señora Olga Marina se dedica a la elaboración de Blusas y al cultivo de follaje (plantas decorativas) desde hace 6 años ella inicio con la ayuda de su suegra para el cultivo y las blusas aprendió con una amiga donde ella entrega su follaje su deseo es seguir superando en su negocio y de esa forma poder variar su producto que ofrece al mercado y a sus clientes que la buscan en su casa, y tambien ser un aporte económico para su familia y la educación de sus hijos,en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para comprar telas para la elaboracion de blusas,y compra de semillas de follaje.
texts.en:
Olga Marina, one of the members of Duo "El Manzanal II", sells blouses and flower arrangements. She first learned about the cultivation of ornamental plants 6 years ago with help from her mother in law, and then she learned the weaving of blouses from a friend where she delivered some of the flower arrangements.  

Olga wishes to continue to succeed in her business in order to offer a greater variety of products to her customers in the market and to the customers that buy from her home. All this to contribute to the finances of her family and to the education of her children.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics for the weaving of blouses and to buy seeds for ornamental plants.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for the weaving of blouses, and to buy seeds for ornamental plants.

loans.name: Sayby

texts.ru: Сайби великодушная женщина. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она работает в средней школе как учительница истории и права с 1981 года. Она имеет большой опыт и свою методику. Многие молодые учителя учатся ее методикой. Сайби и ее муж имеют маленький доход. Ее муж является таксистом. Сайби и ее муж уже несколько лет не в состоянии купить телевизор. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки телевизора. Они мечтают смотреть телевизор. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sayby is a generous woman. She is 50 years old, married, and has two children. She has taught history and law in high school since 1981, so she has a lot of experience. Many young teachers study her teaching methods. Sayby's husband is a taxi driver and they have a small income. They have not been able to buy a TV for many years and have asked for a loan of 3,000 somoni to finally buy one. They dream of watching TV. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a TV set for her household

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Rebecca requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.  She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is 44 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Noeme works very hard to provide for them.

Noeme runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  Noeme has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Noeme would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a banana business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell for her business.  Rona has been in this business for six years. Rona earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Rona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 53 years old.  She is married and has seven children.  Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running a charcoal business for three years and also earns an income from rice and gasoline.  Rosalinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jayvie

texts.en:
Jayvie is 24 years old.  She is a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Jayvie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jayvie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Jayvie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jayvie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 59 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Sarah has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Sarah requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish.  Sarah has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Sarah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 58 years old and married with two children. Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  Cecilia has been in this business for twenty-five years, and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft-drinks, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is 55 years old and has six children. Aquilina is widow and has two children who are in school.   She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Aquilina requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seeds and fertilizers.

Aquilina has been farming vegetable for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Aquilina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed a 44,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 44,000 PHP to buy more products to increase her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Nimpa

texts.en:
Nimpa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine business.

Nimpa has been in this business for two years. Nimpa earns other income from food vending.

Nimpa has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.  She has been in this business for nine years now.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marlyn is 38 years old, and both of her children are in school.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy crude oil, fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Marlyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy crude oil, fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Judith

texts.en:
Ma. Judith is 53 years old and married with two children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Ma. Judith is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy a new variety of rice seeds in preparation for the next crops.  Ma. Judith has been farming rice for 15 years, and also earns additional income from direct selling of Avon and Natasha.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of rice seeds in preparation for the next crops.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Marjorie has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Marjorie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en: Rosevilla is married and has two children.  She runs a general store to make a living. She also sells beauty products in addition to her daily income. Recently, she joined GDMPC and took a loan to purchase additional grocery items and rice to sell. She has been five years in this line of business and she earns a good living. She plans to improve her business and save a portion of her returns for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items and rice to sell

location.town: La Perla Village, Cogon, Dipolog City

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.  She has been in this business for five years.

Rosanna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 40 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Crispina has a business selling ornamental plants in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy flower pots, wire, fertilizers, rope, etc., for her business.

Crispina has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flower pots, wire, fertilizers, rope, etc., for her business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 39 years old and married, with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation for the next crop.

Rosemarie has been farming rice for 19 years, and she also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salaries for land preparation for her next crop

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 53 years old and married.

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lucia has borrowed and repaid no fewer than 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years, and she also earns an income from a restaurant.

Lucia aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 57 years old.  She is married and has nine children.  Thelma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Thelma has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Marilou has been in this business for two years. Marilou earns additional income from general store and raising pigs.  Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. He lives in the town of Ubay, Bohol. Ricky has been in "habal-habal" or motorcycle business for more than sevem years now. Ricky is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle. With this, he will be able to improve his earnings through his motorcycle business.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 56 years old, and she is a widow with four children.  She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Barbara is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.  Barbara has been pig fattening for 12 years, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy more fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing  business.

Julie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Julie's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 42 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Luisa works very hard to provide for them.

Luisa runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.  Luisa has been in this business for 18 years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, coffee, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Luisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, coffee, detergent, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jolita

texts.en:
Jolita is 36 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jolita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jolita has been raising pigs for five years.  She also earns income from buying and selling coconut wine.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 63 years old.  She is married and has six children. Dolores works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, bread, noodles and other groceries.  In the future, Dolores would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gina works hard to support her family.  She has a vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Gina is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for vegetables business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 57 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Pacita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed.

Pacita has been raising pigs for five years, and she also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Chao

texts.en:
Chao is 60 years old and married, with six children. She currently lives with her family in Ponhea Lueu district, Kandal province. 

She sells Khmer noodles with fish soup in her neighborhood, generating an income of KHR 10,000 per day on average to supplement her husband’s income. She has been in this occupation since 2003.

Prior to this loan, Chao took out a loan to fix her house so as to provide good living conditions to her family members. In parallel, she would like to acquire this loan to build fence around her house to protect it and ensure its security. 

Her dreams are to make a stable business and generate a consistent income to provide for her children.

loans.use: to build a fence around her house to protect it and ensure its security

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her granddaughter's university tuition fee and other school related expenses

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 45-year-old single woman who is blessed with five children. She owns a green grocery shop where she sells charcoal and also does crop farming in Limuru. She has been in the business for twelve years now and earns a monthly income of 8,400 Kenya shillings.
 
This will be Esther's fourth loan with KADET LTD; she plans to use the entire loan to buy charcoal and groceries to sell at her grocery shop. With the profits, she wants to expand the business and educate her children. In the future, she wants to buy a plot.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and groceries for her green grocery shop.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa appreciates the people who lent her the loan which she used in her direct selling business. Her business has been running for ten years now, and it continues to grow. Her income from the business has helped with everyday household expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 26,000 PHP for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Tomasa hopes to have a good stall, and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has charcoal business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.  Jocelyn has been in this business for four years now.

Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Om Fady Group

texts.en: This group is called Om Fady and consists of four members. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They are working hard so that they can achieve their goals. Fatima is 30 years old and is the leader of the group. She sells sweets. She has been doing this for three years. She says that she began this business when she felt her husband was unable to cover all the expenses of their family. She is hardworking and through effort and dedication has managed to overcome adversity and get ahead. She is asking for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy sweets in order to be able to continue her business. She is working towards increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy sweets in order to be able to continue her business.

loans.name: Yei

texts.en: Yei is 32 years old and lives in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba County, the second largest populate county in Liberia. The area is rich in natural resources and the living conditions are much better than those in the capital city of Liberia. Yei did not go to school and she grew up in the rural area of Sanniquellie traditionally. She is married and has four children born between 1991 and 2011. She said that two of her children are in school and they all live at home. She received a small amount of money from her husband to establish her business. For ten years she has been running a small local shop where she sells palm oil and rice. She spends 10 hours on her business from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is small income, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and rice for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Wilmer Benigno

texts.es:
Wilmer es una persona de 28 años de edad, que vive con su madre, él es muy conocido en la zona, trabaja en un taller de mecánica automotriz; él tiene de estar trabajando 4 años en el negoció de reparar carro, este oficio lo aprendió por su padre porque lo puso a que aprendiera este oficio, que cuando creciera le iba a servir mucho, hasta hoy en día él todavía se dedica a eso, para mantener a su madre.

Él compra los repuestos en la ciudad y la distancia que tiene que recorrer es de 30 km para poder cómpralo, y él se moviliza con su carro para traer los repuestos.
 
El crédito que solicita, es para comprar unos repuestos para su carro, ya que es el medio que utiliza para trabajar.

El préstamo le mejorara su condición de vida, debido a que por medio de la compra de los repuestos que necesita para arreglar el carro, lo obtendrá por medio del crédito que solicita, y podrá transportarse al pueblo para comprar los alimentos y materiales que necesita para su taller.

Menciona que por la oportunidad que se le ha brindado, él seguirá trabajando con la institución, para realizar otras ideas que tiene en el futuro.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 28 years old and lives with his mother. He is well known in his community and works as a mechanic in an auto shop. Wilmer's father taught him many auto mechanical skills, and 4 years ago Wilmer began working in the auto repair industry. In order to purchase replacement parts for use at the shop, Wilmer has to travel 30 kilometers in his car into a nearby city. With the income he generates from his job Wilmer helps support his mother.

With the support from this loan, Wilmer plans to purchase replacement parts for his own car so that he can continue using it for personal and work-related transportation. Since auto repair is Wilmer's business, he will do the repair work himself to fix his car. He hopes that this investment will help him to improve his quality of life and his effectiveness at work. Having a functioning, efficient car will also help him when he runs other errands in his car into town. Wilmer plans to continue his job and his participation with Fundación Campo.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts for his car, since it is his primary method of transportation for his job.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 50 años vive en compañía de Paulino, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todo menores a los que cuidan en la casa que compraron hace 15 años. Todos los días junto a su esposo, salen a cuidar sus sembríos de maíz y papa en sus terrenos propios, los que cuida con mucho esmero, como le gusta mucho la agricultura y miró la manera de poder utilizar abono orgánico y construyó en su casa un vivero, donde siembra diversas hortalizas y vegetales, esto le sirve a ella para su propio consumo, “así no gasto mucho en los alimentos de mis hijos, además son de calidad pues son orgánicos”, comenta. En época de cosecha, comercializa sus productos en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde ella misma lleva a vender sus alimentos, ya que es conocedora del lugar y los negociantes. Ahora posee 2 vacas que piensa alimentar y engordar para poder extraer leche y así realizar queso, espera concretar su nuevo proyecto, pues quiere comercializarlos en la ciudad, aprovechando los viajes que realiza para comercializar sus propias cosechas.Este es el tercer crédito con Kiva, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta trabajar en su asociación, donde todos son personas responsables y solidarias.
Juana, invertirá los S/.4000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Juana, 50, lives with Paulino, her husband.  They have four children, all minors, they care for in the house they bought 15 years ago.  She and her husband head out daily to care for their potato and corn crops they grow on their own land.  She cares for them with much dedication.  Because she likes agriculture very much she found a way to use organic manure and built a nursery at home where she grows various vegetables for her own consumption.  “This way I don’t spend so much on my children’s food.  In addition, they are better quality because they are organic,” she comments.  

At harvest time, she sells her products in the city of Huancayo where she takes them herself to sell since she knows the place and the merchants. She owns two cows that she plans to feed to fatten up and extract milk to make cheese.  She hopes to get this new project going because she wants to sell it in the city taking advantage of the trips she makes to sell her crops.

This is her 3rd Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the opportunity she’s being given since she’ll be able to improve her business.  She promises to be punctual with her payments, then, for she likes working with her association where all are responsible, mutually supportive people.  Juana will use the 4,000 soles to buy organic manure for her next crop.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her fish-selling business.

Gemma has been in this business for four years. She earns other income from raising pigs.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 49 years old.  She is married and has seven children.  Rosie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Rosie has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile loads and raising pigs.

Rosie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, soft drinks, and other groceries

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials, like fishing nets, etc., for her fishing business.  Sally has been in this business for 23 years. Sally earns additional income from raising pigs.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, like fishing nets, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un señor de 56 años de edad,  es una persona muy conocida en la zona y trabajadora, estudio hasta el sexto grado, él vive con su familia que comprende de su esposa.

Él trabaja en la agricultura y en el comercio de la venta de madera y una tienda que posee en su casa, y a la vez vende animales. Él se traslada a la plaza que está a 5 kilómetros de su casa los día miércoles, que es el día de comercio del pueblo, todo esto lo aprendió de su papá; quien hoy en día ya no está con ellos. 

Desde la edad de los 14 años, comenzó a trabajar en la tienda que tenía su papá, también le enseño de la agricultura. Se transporta en carro hasta la plaza, que llega hasta la casa; porque en la zona no pueden entrar los buses porque la calle esta en pésima condición. 
 
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar un ojo de agua y comercializar con ganado y surtir un poco más la tienda que tiene en su casa. 


El préstamo le mejorara su condición de vida, porqué tendrá mayor ingreso a su casa y poder cubrir sus necesidades.
 

El señor menciona que en un futuro, tiene pensado comprar un carro nuevo, y también ayudar a su familia, para darle una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 56 years old and lives with his wife. He is well known in the community for being an honest and hardworking man. He was able to complete his primary education through sixth grade. Francisco makes a living running several businesses, including wood and timber sales, raising and selling animals and running a small general store out of his home. He sells his goods on Wednesdays in the central plaza of town, which is located 5 kilometers from his home. Since the road from his neighborhood to the central plaza is in awful condition and cannot accommodate buses, Francisco gets rides into town in a car. He learned the agricultural and sales trades from his father, and he actually began working with his father in their general store at age 14. 

With the support from this loan Francisco plans to purchase a waterhole that he can commercialize by selling water rights to farmers with livestock in the area. He also plans to purchase merchandise to stock his general store. Francisco hopes that this investment will help him to strengthen his businesses and in turn increase his income and improve his quality of life. His future goals and dreams include buying a new car and providing for his family to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a waterhole for animal use, as well as merchandise to stock the general store he runs out of his home.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Doña Eusebia
Ella es originaria de la aldea Xetzac Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 42 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pollo y a la fabricación de cajas de madera para verduras.
Desde hace años ella a empezado su negocio y gracias a Dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante, con el crédito que ella recibió lo utilizo para comprar materia prima para su negocio, compro suficientes pollos vivos y madera para elaborar las cajas.
Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y el de sus hijas ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio, para tener mejores ganancias y asi mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor,esta solcitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de cajas para transportar verduras.
texts.en:
Eusebia’s from the village of Xetzac, Tecpán , Guatemala.  She’s 42-years-old and her minor children are her responsibility.  She works selling chicken and making wood vegetable crates.

She started her business years ago and thanks to God has gradually been able to get ahead.  She used the loan she got to buy raw materials for her business.
