She bought enough live chickens and wood to manufacture the crates.  She continues in business thanks to her husband’s and her daughters’ help.

Her dream is to expand the businesses more to earn higher profits and send her children to school for a better future.  She’s asking for this loan to buy raw materials to make crates to transport vegetables.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to manufacture vegetable crates.

loans.name: Ahit

texts.en:
Mr.Ahit is 47 years old.  He lives with his wife and son in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife, Amanhan, is 47 and operates a small organic fruit and vegetable booth in the local market. 

Ahit has been running a taxi service in town for five years and has been well-known among his clients. He is a hardworking, very friendly man who always has a smile on his face.  His car has been broken for awhile, and he is now planning to buy a second-hand, better car to continue providing his taxi service in town. He would prefer to buy a new car but he cannot afford it and is now requesting 3,000,000MNT to purchase a second-hand, but better car to continue providing his taxi service business.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand car to continue providing his taxi service business

loans.name: Dúo Tierra Prometida Group

texts.es:
DUO TIERRA PROMETIDA

La señorita Cesia Antoniela de 29 años, soltera, desde hace dos (2) años posee una venta de cosméticos por catalogos ubicada en El Tejar Chimaltenango, a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella ha mantenido y a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de Cesia es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a KIVA FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar más productos de belleza en cosmeticos para seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
One of the members of the duo Tierra Prometida is Cesia Antoniela, who is 29 years old and has been running a cosmetics sales business for the past two years. She sells products from a catalog, and her business is located in the district of El Tejar in the city of Chimaltenango. Cesia works very hard to provide for her family, and she has been able to put some of her income from the business towards improvements on her house. 

With the support from this loan, Cesia plans to purchase merchandise to stock her cosmetics business. She hopes that this investment will help her to strengthen and expand her business and in turn help her to achieve her dream of improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La socia Natalia pertenece al banco comunal “Pro Mujer De Huayocari”, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de granos secos, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de granos secos como cebada, maíz entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Natalie belongs to the Pro Mujer De Huayocari communal bank.  The member continues with her business of selling dried grains.  The member has been in this business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  The member is a responsible and hard-working person.  Being this way, the member gets her family ahead.

The member requested the loan to buy dried grains like barley and corn, among others.  The member is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: to buy dried grains like barley and corn, among others.

loans.name: Juntas Y Unidas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Guillermina ella es casada tiene 59 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de tortas para los distintos compromisos que le solicitan como matrimonios, fiesta de 15 años,cumpleaños,bautizos entre otros, la socia trabaja a pedido, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la venta de tejidos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeño siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, matequilla, azucar entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de libros, negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de venta de tejidos, brindando el servicio de taxi, polleria, venta de desayunos y negocio de venta de materiales de construcción.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The communal bank "Together And United" and its members are from the district of Cusco, part of the province and department of Cusco. One member is Ms. Guillermina, a married woman of 59 years with four children. Guillermina alternates between two businesses. In one, she makes cakes to order for various events like weddings, quinceañera ("Sweet Fifteen") parties, birthdays, baptisms, and other events. She has spent quite some time in this business, and it is going well for her, thanks to the dedication she brings to her work. Her other business is the sales of knit items. Guillermina is a responsible and resolute person, and with her hard work, she is getting her family ahead. Guillermina is requesting this loan to pay for ingredients such as flour, butter, and sugar, among others. The other members of the group have a variety of businesses, including book sales, cake sales, the selling of knitted products, taxi services, the raising of chickens, the preparation and sales of breakfast, and the sales of construction materials. The member in the attached photograph requested that she be allowed to come late to the meeting due to her work obligations. Guillermina and all the members wish to thank everyone who has formed part of this dream and she promises to repay the loan on time and in the prescribed manner.

loans.use: buy ingredients to bake cakes for weddings and birthdays.

loans.name: Maria Iris

texts.es:
La socia Maria Iris se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno donde siembra verduras como habas,zanahorias,cebollas entre otras verduras,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria continues her vegetable farming operation where she grows carrots, onions, lima beans and other vegetables. She works from 8:00 every morning until 6:00 every evening, and she has five years of experience in this trade. Her business is going well, and her dream is to eventually open up a store where she can sell her produce. 

With the support from this loan, Maria plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating her vegetable crops. Maria is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Prapapon

texts.en:
Prapapon was born and raised in a poor Hmong hill-tribe family.  More fortunate than most hill-tribe children, she was able to attend school and learned to read and write in Thai.  When Prapapon grew up, she married a young man from a Hmong family and moved to the village of Ban Huay Hom, about 50 km from her home. 

The young newlyweds had a hard time building a life together and finding a secure source of income, despite their reputations as hard workers.  Prapapon was excited when she discovered the opportunity to weave hammocks and applied herself to learn how to weave every variety of hammock.  As more weavers were trained in the art of hammock weaving, Prapapon’s reading and writing skills came in handy!  She helps decipher the pattern sheets for weavers who can’t read. 

Prapapon is now 25 years old and has six children.  She is more committed than ever to providing for her family and making sure her children can receive an education.  She has grown into more responsibility and her organizational skills help her oversee production for nearly 50 of her fellow Hmong weavers.  With this loan, she will be able to get her own production going and become an independent producer.

loans.use: to get her own hammock production going and become an independent producer.

loans.name: Dúo Mariposas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mariposas
Dúo conformado por floridalma madre de familia y muy trabajadora, Floridalma se dedica a la crianza de pollos se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 año ya que esta actividad que realiza ayuda a su familia economicamente, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de animales para la crianza ya que se aserca la epoca de fina de año y nececita tener animales (pollos) para vender esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Butterflies Duo

Floridalma’s a very hardworking mother who works raising chickens.  She’s been in this activity six years since the activity helps her family economically.  She’s requesting this loan to buy animals to raise for the end of year season is approaching and she needs to have animals (chickens) to sell.  She hopes you will be able to help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es:
La socia Piedad pertenece al banco comunal “Pro Mujer De Huayocari” ,la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar,leche entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz, leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Piedad is a member of the “Pro Mujer de Huayocari” communal bank.  She continues with her business selling basic staples.  She’s been in business for a good amount of time now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.   She sells basic staples like rice and milk, among others.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person who is supporting her family this way.

She’s asking for the loan to buy merchandise like rice, milk and others.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Aygul

texts.ru: Айгул 44 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Айгул - средне-специальное образование, работает преподавателем в местной школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Айгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 1 телка, 1 лошадь, а также имеет 8,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает клевер и ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Aygul is 44 years old, a widow and raising three children alone after her husband's death and also running her own business. Avezkul has a secondary-specialized education and works as a teacher at a local school. To provide additional income for her family, Aygul is involved in animal husbandry, having started 25 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aygul's hard work, today her business contains 5 dairy cows, 1 heifer, 1 horse and also 8 hectares of land, where she annually grows clover and barley. The monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Aygul requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy sheep in order to increase livestock headcount. Aygul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel de 37 años, vive desde hace ya 15 años en la comunidad, , junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos; quienes actualmente están estudiando educación básica. Su negocio es, una pequeña tienda de artículos de primera necesidad y una venta de pupusas.

La pupuseria tiene 6 años de estar funcionando. Este oficio lo aprendió de su madre y pues le da buenos dividendos. Las horas de trabajo generalmente, es al atardecer en donde su negocio tiene mayor demanda. En el negocio se involucra su esposo, quien le ayuda con la atención a los clientes.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más productos para la tienda y para el negocio de la pupuseria. Tendrá mejores ventas y mayores ingresos, para solventar los compromisos en su familia. La necesidad es que tendrá un negocio más rentable y más clientela.

Los planes a futuro, son trabajar duro al lado de su esposo para brindar una buena educación  a sus hijos,que para su forma de pensar es la mejor herencia que pueden dejarles.
texts.en:
Isabel, 37, has lived in her community for 15 years already with her husband and two children who are currently in primary school.  Her business is a small grocery store and ‘pupusa’ [filled, grilled corn cakes] sales.  

The pupusa shop has been in operation six years.  She learned this occupation from her mother and it produces good dividends.  Her work hours generally start at dusk which is when demand is highest.  Her husband helps her take care of customers.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy more merchandise for the store and for the pupusa business.  She will have better sales and higher income to cover family expenses.  She needs to have a more profitable business and a larger clientele.

Her future plan is to work hard alongside her husband to provide a good education for her children that to her way of thinking is the best legacy they can possibly give them.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store and for her fast-food business.

loans.name: San  Roque Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ROQUE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa ella es casada y tiene 64 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 p.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo.carne y verduras.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de leche, negocio de venta de joyas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Roque" and its members are from the Cusco district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

One member is Teresa. She is married, is 64 years old, and has two children. Teresa runs her own restaurant. She makes different dishes like chicken with potatoes, soups, and "saltado de carne," a stir-fried Peruvian dish of meats and vegetables.  She works from 10:00pm until 5:00pm. She has been running her restaurant for seven years, and it is going well for her. She dreams of expanding her restaurant.  Teresa plans to use the loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, beef, and vegetables.

The members shown attached to the group picture had their photos taken after the meeting, which they requested due to work conflicts. The other members run a wide variety of businesses, including the sale of milk, the sale of jewelry, a grocery store, and food sales.

Teresa thanks everyone who has been part of making her dream a reality through this lending system, and she promises to repay the loan on time and in the prescribed manner.

loans.use: buy ingredients like chicken and steak for her restaurant.

loans.name: In-2013-671 Group

texts.es:
DUO MARAVILLOSO AMOR DE DIOS
La señora Berta Elisa de 39 años, soltera,  desde hace 3 años posee una Tortillería ubicada Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de señora Berta es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar Maíz y leña  para seguir creciendo con su tortillería.
texts.en:
Berta Elisa is 39 years old and is one of the two members of the duo, "Maravilloso Amor de Dios" (Marvelous Love of God). For the past three years, Berta has run a tortilla making business in the city of Chimaltenango. Through her hard work and dedication, she has been able to save up her income and make some improvements to her house and support her family.

With the support from this loan, Berta plans to purchase corn for making and selling tortillas at her business. She hopes that this investment will help her to strengthen and grow her business and in turn improve both her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn for making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Aydee Florencia

texts.es:
La socia Aydee pertenece al banco comunal “Pro Mujer De Huayocari” ,la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez también continua dedicándose a la venta de verduras como papas, lechuga entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando en sus negocios para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Aydee is a member of the community bank, "Pro Mujer De Huayocari." She continues her business raising and selling small animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens and other animals. Aydee has many years experience in this trade, and she believes business is going well thanks to her hard work and dedication. She also farms vegetables such as potatoes and lettuce to generate additional income and support her family.

With the support from this loan, Aydee plans to purchase guinea pigs for her business. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 36 years old and is married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Liezel is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a soft drink retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

Liezel has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of soft drinks to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft-drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.es:
La socia Nazaria se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,la socia siembra y cosecha verduras y frutas,la socia siembra zanahorias,brocolis,manzanas,duraznos entre otros,la socia los vende en los diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Nazaria continues in the business of farming. She grows and harvests vegetables and fruit like carrots, broccoli, apples, peaches, and then selling them in various markets. She works from 6:00am until 4:00pm. She also raises animals. Her dream is to have a business location of her own where she can sell her fruits and vegetables. Nazaria will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her crops. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Rosa Rosenda

texts.es: Rosa Rosenda, 47 años de edad acompañada con dos hijos menores de edad aun, originaria de uno de los municipios del norte del país, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de producto de consumo para las pulperia de forma ambulante a todas las pulperias del municipio sus ventas son al contado y al crédito sus compras las realiza en otros municipio del país, las cuales son al contado,su negocio lo inicio con capital propio producto de sus ahorros, en busca de un medio para mantener a sus pequeños hijos, uno de los sueños de Rosa es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios, ella es una mujer trabajadora, con buenos principios morales, responsable, y con muchos deseos de superacion. Rosa actualmente solicita credito para la compra de capital de trabajo como: gaseosas, golosinas, galletas, jugos, ropa, entre otros, el cual le ayudara apoder mejorar el inventario de su negocio y podra obtener mejores ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia.-
texts.en:
Rosa Rosenda, 47, has a spouse and two children who are still minors.  She’s from one of the municipalities in the country’s north.  She sells all types of grocery items from place to place to various grocery stores in the municipality.  Her sales are cash and on credit and she makes her purchases in other municipalities in the country and pays cash.  

She started her business with her own savings searching for a way to support her children.  One of Rosa’s dreams is that her business grows and that her children can complete their schooling.

She’s a hardworking mother with good moral principles.  She’s responsible and very much wants to improve.   She’s asking for the loan at present to buy working capital like soft-drinks, snacks, cookies, juices and clothes, among others that will help her improve her business’ inventory to earn higher income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Teresita Del Socorro

texts.es: Teresita, a sus 54 años de edad, se ha dedicado durante muchos años a trabajar como empleada doméstica en diferentes casas de familia y de esta manera generaba los ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar, ya que él labora como oficial de construcción y algunas veces esta actividad es muy inestable e incierta. Vivían en un barrio popular de la ciudad, pero debido a la violencia y conflictos entre bandas criminales del sector, ella, en compañía de su esposo se vieron obligados a trasladarse para otro barrio, procurando cuidar sus vidas que se veían expuestos a muchos riesgos externos. Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ingresos y de cambiar de actividad, ella decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio, por lo que renunció al trabajo que tenía y, con la liquidación y algunos ahorros inició una pequeña tienda de abarrotes hace aproximadamente 7 meses, la cual ubicó en un pequeño espacio de su casa y compró estanterías y surtido para comenzar con su proyecto productivo. Su perseverancia, empuje y su espíritu emprendedor la llevan a buscar nuevas alternativas que le permitan seguir adelante, por ello se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el que desea comprar  un enfriador y surtido al por mayor (cárnicos, lácteos, mecato, granos, productos de aseo, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer y satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, lo que dará como resultado un incremento notable en las ventas y en el margen de utilidades que recibe por su labor. De esta manera, Teresita desea seguir luchando para sacar adelante su negocio, dándose a conocer por su buen servicio y por la variedad y calidad de los productos que ofrece, pues desea convertirlo en una actividad rentable y así poder descansar de sus labores como empleada doméstica, además quiere apoyar a su esposo para disfrutar de un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida y, vivir una vejez tranquila al lado de su amado esposo.
texts.en:
Teresita, 54, has worked as a domestic employee in private homes for many years and earns enough income this way to help her husband cover household expenses since he works in construction and sometimes this occupation is unstable and uncertain.  They used to live in a popular neighborhood in the city but due to violence and gang warfare she and her husband had to move to a different neighborhood to preserve their lives for they were exposed to many external risks.

Aiming at improving their income and change activity, she decided to open her own business and work independently.  She resigned from the job she had and used her severance pay and some savings she had to open a small grocery store about 7 months ago.  She installed it in a small space at home and bought shelving and stock to start her productive project.  

Her perseverance, drive and enterprising spirit have led her to seek new alternatives that will make it possible for her to continue forward.  This is what motivates her to request the loan she wants to use to buy a cooler and stock at wholesale (meat products, dairy products, packaged snacks, grains, cleaning supplies, etc.)  This will allow her to have more variety of products on-hand to meet customer needs and wants which will result in a significant increase in sales and profits earned from her labor.

In this way, Teresita intends to continue working to move her business forward becoming known for the good service and variety and quality of goods she sells.  She wants to turn it into a profitable activity so she can rest from her work as a domestic employee.  She also wants to support her husband so that they can enjoy well-being and quality of life and to live a peaceful old-age at the side of her beloved husband.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and stock merchandise.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las trabajadoras, ya que eso es lo que son todas ellas, mujeres trabajadoras que luchan y que quieren salir adelante. Están en su primer ciclo, con muchas ganas de ir creciendo como grupo y como persona.
Leticia es una persona muy trabajadora, y con su trabajo ayuda a su esposo y a su hijo, haciendo un poco más ligera la carga por medio de su ingreso. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que hace zapatillas bordadas y los vende por pedido, sus clientas siempre están muy conformes con las hermosas zapatillas que hace, y es por eso que le va muy bien.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, adornos, kit de lentejuelas  entre otros para seguir bordando las zapatillas que hace; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called "the workers", which is what they are; working women that strive and want to get ahead.  They are working on their first cycle, with much enthusiasm to grow as a group and as individuals.
Leticia is a very hardworking person, with her work she helps her husband and son, making the heavy burden a bit lighter through her income.  Some of the work she does are embroidered shoes that she sells by the order, her customers are always happy with the beautiful shoes she makes and this is why she does well.
She requests a loan to buy fabric, decorative items, sequin kits and other products to embroider shoes the way she has been, this will help her materialize her business plan, which will help her improve income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, decorative items, sequin kits and other products.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Angel, mayor de edad, casado con cinco hijos los cuales todos son independientes, originario del municipio de Chinandega zona donde predomina el comercio, turismo entre otros, Miguel  se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador, responsables. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad para aporta a los gastos del hogar. Gracia a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante decide poner una carpintería ubicada en su casa de habitación donde elabora distintos estilos de muebles como: roperos, camas., puertas, milusos, gabeteros, cunas, distintos estilos de sillas, muebles de oficinas, comedores, entre otros mas, negocio el cual tiene ya varios años y el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco con el transcurso  de tiempo se ha dado a conocer por calidad de trabajo que el presente siempre a sus clientes. El objetico de este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como madera, tornillos, pegas, juncos, selladores, lakas, lijas, entre otros. Miguel Angel agradece la ayuda de los inversionistas kiva a las personas de escasos recursos para  tener fuentes de trabajo digno en países pobre económicamente como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Miguel Angel is an older gentleman, married with five grown independent children, originally from Chinandega where business and tourism predominate. Miguel is a hard-working responsible man. Sadly because of a lack of economic resources he could pursue a university career, and he recognized the need to be working from a young age to support his household's expenses. Thanks to his enterprising spirit and his desire to succeed he decided to open a carpentry business in his home where he makes various styles of furniture such as: dressers, beds, doors, filing cabinets, desks, various styles of chairs, office furniture, dining room sets and more. He has had the business for several years and it has grown little by little over time, making him well known for the quality of the work he always presents to his customers. This loan will be used to buy materials such as wood, nails, screws, glue, sealant, cane and other items. Miguel Angel is thankful for the help from Kiva investors they provide to people will few resources in order to have sources of honorable work in economically poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, nails, screws, glue, sealant, cane and other items.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
La señora Bernarda es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, desde hace 10 años.
Doña Bernarda tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación y sus clientes son los vecinos de su municipio y lugares cercanos que recorre ofreciendo su producto. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de cremas, lociones, perfumes, polvos, sombras, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo.
Doña Bernarda espera que el préstamo le sea de mucha ayuda y que sus ventas aumenten y por ende sus ingresos para que le permitan mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Doña Bernarda espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Bernarda’s a very hardworking, responsible woman living with her family in a community in southern Honduras.  Her business for the last ten years has been cosmetics sales.

Bernarda’s business is located at home and her customers are neighbors from her town and nearby places she visits selling her goods.  She needs the loan to buy creams, lotions, perfume, talc, eye shadow, etc. to continue doing her work.

Bernarda hopes that the loan will be of much help for her and that her sales will increase and her income will too as a result that will make it possible for her to improve her and her family’s quality of life a little

She hopes in the short run to make her business grow to be able to continue supporting her family and that her children get the necessary schooling so that they will have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – October, 2013

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ana Yerling

texts.es: Ana es una joven originaria de la Ciudad de Chinandega. De 26 años de edad y soltera. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio con mucho esfuerzo y sacrifico ya que fue por medio de la liquidación final de su trabajo anterior el cual  desempeñaba como secretaria. Solicita el crédito para comprar: arroz, azúcar, huevos, gaseosa, embutidos, etc. con el fin de abastecer su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ingresos y mejorara su calidad de vida. Su meta próxima es aumentar más su inventario y su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 26, is a young woman from the city of Chinandega.  She’s a merchant selling grocery items.  She started her business with much effort and sacrifice using her severance pay from her previous job as a secretary.

She’s asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, eggs, soft-drinks, sausages, etc. to stock the store and meet customer needs.  She figures the loan will be of great help to her for it will increase her income and improve her quality of life.  Her next goal is to increase inventory still more and in future to improve the store’s infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maira

texts.es:
Doña Maira  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su  familia en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. 
Doña Maira  necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal para seguir elaborando sus tortillas y contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar. espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera espera que las ventas tengan un aumento considerable.
Doña Maira  el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos. Espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia a que tenga una mejor calidad de  vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre  2013
texts.en:
Maira is a very hardworking, responsible woman who lives with her family in a small community in the southern region of Honduras. She makes and sells tortillas for a living, and her tortillas are well known as some of the best and most popular in the area. As her only source of income, her tortilla business is very important for her family's livelihood.

With the support from this loan, Maira plans to purchase corn, firewood and lime powder for making her tortillas. She hopes that this investment will help her to strengthen and expand her business and increase her profits and ability to meet customer demand. Maira's dream is to continue growing her business and to make it the most popular in town so she can support her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood and lime powder for making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Angela 	Soledad

texts.es: Doña Ángela es originaria de la Ciudad de Chinandega. De 49 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio esta actividad con ayuda de su esposo que le proporciono un dinero para poner una pequeña venta, la cual ahora es una pulpería completa. Solicita el crédito para comprar: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, pollo, entre otros con el fin de surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Estima que este crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas e ingresos y mejorara su calidad de vida. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y su plan futuro es convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Ángela is from the city of Chinandega.  She is 49 years old, married, and has two children.  She is a merchant, and her business is a grocery store.  She started this business activity with the help of her husband.  He provided her with some money in order to be able to set up her small sales business.  It is now a complete grocery store.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, and chicken, among others.  She will do this in order to stock her business and satisfy her customers’ needs.  She thinks that this loan will be a big help because it will increase her sales and income and improve her quality of life.

Her next goal is to improve the infrastructure of her business.  Her plan for the future is to convert her grocery store into a general store.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, and chicken, among others.

loans.name: Jhon Alejandro

texts.es: Jhon es un joven emprendedor que, a sus 18 años de edad, ya es padre de un hijo de 6 meses de nacido. Hace 10 meses aproximadamente se le presentó la oportunidad de comprar una tienda de abarrotes, ubicada en el barrio donde reside, aprovechando que ésta ya contaba con una trayectoria en el sector, allí trabaja de Lunes a Domingo de 8:00 am a 10:00 pm, pero los fines de semana su horario se extiende hasta las 2:00 am ya que también ofrece cervezas y licor. Cuenta con la ventaja de que en la zona las personas acostumbran a comprar los alimentos para el día a día por lo que sus ventas siempre son buenas. Cuenta con el apoyo de su novia que también posee conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocio. El titular se caracteriza por tener un espíritu de superación y un positivismo que lo impulsan a buscar nuevas alternativas para salir adelante, por ello, solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará surtido al por mayor (lácteos, cárnicos, pastas, granos, cervezas, licor, y otros productos de la canasta familiar), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y ofrecer más variedad de productos para satisfacer los diferentes gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, lo que se reflejará en el incremento de sus ventas y el margen de utilidades que recibe. De esta forma, Jhon desea seguir trabajando con empeño y dedicación, para que en un futuro cercano pueda cumplir el sueño de culminar sus estudios universitarios y así tener la capacidad para brindar a su hijo un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida, además desea hacer de su negocio una microempresa rentable y sostenible en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Jhon is a young entrepreneur who, at just 18 years of age, is already the father of a 6-month-old son. About ten months ago, an opportunity presented itself to him to buy a small grocery store located in the neighborhood where he lives. He took advantage of this, as he was already on track in the area, and he works there Monday through Sunday from 8:00 am until 10:00 pm, but on weekends, he stays open until 2:00 am selling beers and liquor. 

He takes advantage of a number of repeat customers who are in the habit of buying food from him day after day, which helps his sales. He also relies upon the support of his girlfriend, who also has the knowledge and skills to run this type of business. This business owner is characterized by a strong drive to succeed and a positive attitude, which drive him to seek out new ways to get ahead.  

To do this, he is requesting a loan which he will use to stock his store at wholesale, buying goods like dairy and meat products, pasta and grains, beer, liquor, and other sundries. This will help him continue with his work and offer a wider variety of products to meet his customers needs and tastes, which will be reflected back in the form of increased sales and profits. Jhon wishes to keep working with drive and dedication so that in the near future, he can achieve his dream of finishing his studies at university and thus give his son a better life. He also wants to make his small business a profitable venture and sustainable in the future.

loans.use: purchase stock for his general store at wholesale.

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es:
El Joven Carlos José es una persona muy esforzada ya que con mucho sacrificio logro finalizar sus estudios de ingeniería en sistemas.

 El Joven Carlos José labora como operador en un Call Center de la ciudad de león  empieza sus labores a las 7:30 am finalizando a las 6:00 pm.

El crédito que solicito el Joven Carlos José a Ceprodel  fue utilizado para el pago de los módulos de graduación y culminación de su carrera lo cual le servirá para mejorar los ingresos dándole un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Young Carlos José is a very dedicated person who with much sacrifice has succeeded in completing systems engineering studies.  He works as an operator in a Call Center in the city of León and starts work at 7:30am and ends at 6:00pm

The loan he asked from Ceprodel was used to pay for his graduation fees and to complete his studies that will help him improve his income and provide better well-being for his family.

loans.use: to pay graduation fees.

loans.name: Gertrudis Patricia

texts.es: La señora Gertrudis se dedica al actividad de su pulperia desde hace 9 años empezo su negocio como venta de tajadas donde ella entragaba a las escuelas cercanas de su domicilio, poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio ahora tiene una pulperia donde vende de todo un poco, es madre de 2 hijos ambos estan en edad escolar por los que se sacrifica para sacarlos adelante, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche.  es casada, solicita el financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio e incrementar su inventario y sus ingresos ya que ofreciendoles productos a sus clientes tendra sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gertrudis has been a grocer for nine years.  She started her business selling fried plantain slices at schools near her house and gradually increased her business.  Now she has a grocery store where she sells a little of everything.  

She’s mother of two children both of which are school age.  She sacrifices for them to move them forward.  She works Monday to Sunday from five in the morning until eight at night.  She’s married.

She’s asking for the loan to invest it in her business and increase inventory and income because by offering the products to her customers her profits will rise.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maritza Isabel se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos de primera nesecidad desde hace 7 años en el parque, es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ella esta en edad escolar cursa su universidad, con mucho esfuerzo la señora los ha sacado adelante, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, solicita financiamiento para comprar mercaderia para su negocio e incrementar  su inventario y asi mantener sus ventas.
texts.en: Maritza Isabel works selling basic staple goods in the park.  She’s been doing so for the last 7 years.  She’s mother of four children one of which is still dependent on her and is school age attending university.   She’s moved them ahead with much effort.  She works Monday to Sunday from seven in the morning to five in the afternoon.  She’s asking for the loan to buy merchandise for her business to increase inventory and maintain her sales.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to sell.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
María, aprovechara la temporada de enflorar difuntos, para generar ingresos con los que no cuenta pero que necesita para salir adelante. Comprará variedad de flores, espuma floral y listones, para elaborar arreglos florales.
Ella ha invertido préstamos en su negocio anteriormente, y tuvo buenos resultados amplio su negocio tiene mucho más clientes,  genero ingresos que le ayudaron a pagar su deuda y mejoro su vivienda. María les enseño el oficio a sus hijos y hoy tiene más apoyo para salir a tiempo con la producción.
texts.en:
María hopes to take full advantage of the upcoming floral busy season to increase her income and strengthen her business. With the support from this loan, she plans to purchase a variety of flowers, floral foam, ribbons and other items for making her floral arrangements.

María has invested previous loans in her business and has been very pleased with the results. She has been able to leverage past loans to increase her customer base, expand her business, make improvements to her house and pay back the loans. María is presently teaching her children the floral trade and also benefitting from their help in meeting customer deadlines.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of flowers, floral foam, ribbons and other supplies for making her floral arrangements.

loans.name: Dúo Damas Laboriosas Antigua Group

texts.es: Las Señoras Vilma del Carmen se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, ropa Americana les gusta el negocio, pero muchas veces el negocio es bajo y obtienen muy pocas ganancias por esa razón ellas se dedican a una segunda actividad como es a la produccion de hongos solicitan este crédito para invertir en la producción de hongos ya que con su negocio ellas ayudan a su familia para el sosten de hongar.
texts.en: Vilma del Carmen and Cornelia are in the business of selling American clothing for men, women, and children. They like the business, but a lot of the time, business is down and they aren't able to earn much. That's why they are turning to a second activity: raising mushrooms. They are requesting this loan to invest in the production of mushrooms. This business will help them to sustain their families and households.

loans.use: buy the supplies to raise mushrooms.

loans.name: Kulnara

texts.ru: Кульнаре 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 дочь. У Кульнары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кульнара занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 35,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кульнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 5 овец, куры, а также имеет 1,5 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель и сеет зерновые культуры. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кульнара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кульнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kulnara is 51 years old, married and raising a daughter together with her husband. Kulnara has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, Kulnara is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 16 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 35,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kulnara's hard work, today her business contains 4 dairy cows, 1 horse, 5 sheep, chickens and also has 1.5 hectares of land, where she annually grows potatoes and sows cereal crops. The monthly income amounts to 8,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Kulnara requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a cow in order to increase livestock headcount. Kulnara plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Javier Eduardo

texts.es: Javier es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad, su vida productiva la comenzó trabajando como empleado en una tienda de abarrotes, allí obtuvo la experiencia y el conocimiento necesario para el manejo de este tipo de negocios y, por iniciativa propia decidió comprarle el negocio a su jefe, poco a poco fue pagando por cuotas el valor del establecimiento y, desde hace 8 meses pasó de ser empleado a propietario del negocio, allí ofrece mecato, productos de aseo, lácteos, cárnicos, gaseosas, entre otros y, presta el servicio de Lunes a Domingo, con esta labor ha podido mejorar sus ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Su empuje, energía y su actitud positiva lo motivan para solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de vitrinas y estanterías nuevas para almacenar sus productos, pues esto le permitirá dar una mejor imagen a su negocio y así podrá atraer a nuevos clientes para ofrecerles un excelente servicio y una gran variedad de productos, mejorando sus ventas y la rentabilidad de su negocio. De esta manera Javier desea seguir luchando para alcanzar sus objetivos, especialmente el de ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en un minimercado, abriendo la posibilidad de mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar para su familia.
texts.en: Javier is a 22 year old enterprising young man. He began working as an employee in a grocery store. There he obtained experience and knowledge necessary to manage this type of business, and through his own initiative he decided to buy the business from his boss. Little by little he made the payments for the business, and 8 months ago he went from being an employee to being the owner of the business. He sells pastries, cleaning supplies, dairy products, meat, soda pop, and other items. He is open Monday through Sunday. With this work he has been able to improve his income in order to support his household. His drive, energy and positive attitude motivate him to seek a loan with the goal of investing it in buying  display cases and new stands to display his products. This will allow him to give a better presentation of his business and be able to attract new customers in order to offer them excellent service and a great variety of products, thus improving his sales and profitability of his business. In this way Javier wishes to continue fighting to achieve his goals, especially expanding his business and converting it into a minimarket, opening the possibility of improving his quality of live and well being of his family.

loans.use: to buy display cases and new stands to display his products.

loans.name: Claudia Zorayda

texts.es: Claudia es una joven originaria de Chinandega. De 28 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Ella es una mujer emprendedora la cual desde sus 18 años heredo el negocio de su mama (pulpería)  que ha sostenido hasta el día de hoy. Solicita el crédito para comprar: arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, jabón, pasta dental, entre otros con el fin de surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas y  obtendrá más ingresos. Su meta próxima es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y abastecerlo ya que es la única pulpería en su zona. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio. Su expectativa es tener  estabilidad en su negocio y con el paso del tiempo no depender de financiamientos para ser auto sostenible.
texts.en: Claudia is a young woman originally from Chinandega. She is 28 years old, married, and mother of two children. She is a businesswoman with a small convenience store. She is an enterprising woman, inheriting this business from her mother 18 years ago and she has kept it going up through today. She seeks a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, soap, toothpaste, and other items with the goal of stocking her business and satisfying the needs of her customers. She anticipates that the loan will be a great help to increase her sales and obtain more income. Her next goal is to continue investing in her business and stocking it as it is the only convenience store in her area. Her future plan is to improve the infrastructure of her business. She expects to have stability in her business and over time will not need to depend on financing in order to be self sustaining.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, soap, toothpaste, and other items.

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es:
El joven José Noel es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es un taller de vidriería y balconearía, desde hace  15 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. 
José Noel necesita el préstamo para la compra de más materiales como metales, vidrios, soldadores, etc. para seguir  realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los materiales necesarios para cubrir los pedidos y trabajos solicitados.
José Noel gracias a esta inversión espera poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. y en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre  del  2013
texts.en:
José Noel is a hardworking and responsible young person. He lives in a community in southern Honduras with his family. He has had a glassworks and balcony workshop for 15 years which is located in his home in the town where he lives.

José Noel needs a loan in order to buy more supplies such as metal, glass, soldering irons, etc. to continue doing his work which provides a large part of his income. With the loan he hopes that his sales will increase and this will help a lot as he does not have enough supplies to cover the orders and solicited work.

José Noel offers thanks for this investment as he expects to be able to improve the quality of life a little for his family with the increase in household earnings and in a short while be able to grow his business and continue supporting his family. 


Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy metal, glass, soldering irons, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
Las 15 mujeres del grupo son todas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Caacupé, son mujeres jefas de familia, que se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias, y por medio de ese trabajo poder salir adelante.
La señora Aida es integrante del comité, es vendedora de ropas y calzados en general, y por medio de su trabajo y su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Comenta que se hizo de muy buena clientela gracias a que es muy hábil para las ventas. Hoy pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas de todo tipo y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos que ofrecer a su familia.
texts.en:
The 15 women of the group are all friends and neighbors from the city of Caacupé.  They are female heads of household that joined together to be able to help their families and by means of this work be able to get ahead.

Aida’s a member of the committee.  She sells clothes and shoes in general and by means of her work and effort is getting ahead.  She comments that she’s acquired a very good clientele thanks to her sales skills.  She’s asking for this loan today to buy clothes of all types to be able to continue with her sales and earn higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy varied clothes to sell.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run is a 56-year-old lady with six children, two of whom are married already and living independently.  

To generate an income, she has a small farm where she grows rice and cassava that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for years and always gets support from her husband and children.

She has never been a client of local MFIs or state banks before. Since HKL finances its loan with suitable interest and repayment terms, Run has decided to borrow to buy a motorcycle for household purposes. 

This purchase will facilitate her transportation needs and allow her to go anywhere easily. 

She expresses her thanks for generosity that lenders offer through its partners.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for household purposes.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena, es casada, vive con su hija de 18 años y una tía. Trabaja de forma independiente  en su negocio de venta de ropa y pupusería, es una actividad que la aprendió de su familia, lo maneja con toda facilidad, no se le complica atenderlo porque ya cuenta con 10 años de experiencia.
Invertirá en la compra de ropa para ambos sexos (variedad de estilos, tallas y colores), con la nueva mercadería ella tendrá el inventario necesario para trabajar y aumentar sus ingresos con los cuales ella cancelara el crédito y mejorara las condiciones de su familia.
Su sueño es poder adquirir su propia casa y darle el apoyo a su hija para que pueda asistir a la universidad para ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Lorena’ s married living with her 18-year-old daughter and her aunt.  She works independently in her clothing business and selling pupusas [filled, grilled corn cakes], an activity she learned from her family.  She manages everything with ease and tending to it isn’t complicated because she has ten years’ experience already.

She will invest in the purchase of clothes for both genders (assorted styles, sizes and colors).  With the new merchandise she’ll have the necessary inventory to work and increase income to repay the loan and improve family conditions.

Her dream is to be able to buy a house of her own and to support her daughter so she can attend university and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As the widowed parent of seven children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from food vending. 

Aida is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets, an ice box, and other fishing materials for her business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, an ice box, and other fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
This is Lito, who is 38 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is a widower, and he has children. He manages their household while operating his business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his family’s everyday expenses.  

Lito operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families eat home-cooked meals only during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for only one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 12, 000 loan. He will use the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings.

Lito dreams that his children will finish their studies and hopes that his business will flourish. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.  It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and other products needed in his business.

loans.name: Josselyn Lisbeth

texts.es:
Josselyn, está fortaleciendo el inventario del negocio y necesita capital para comprar azúcar, jabón, maíz, arroz y otros productos de la canasta básica. Con el crédito anterior su negocio fue bien surtido, lo que le ayudo a seguir trabajando sin ningún problema, pago sus deudas y su economía mejoro.
La familia mantiene el mismo número de personas, tienen mejor alimentación, mejor condición económica.
texts.en: Josselyn’s strengthening her business’ inventory and needs capital to buy sugar, soap, corn, rice and other basic staple goods.  She used the previous loan to keep her store well-stocked which helped her stay in business problem-free.  She repaid her debts and her economy improved.  Her family has the same number of members, their nutrition is better and so is their economic condition.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es: Luis, Solicita capital para invertirlo en el negocio de siembra de granos básicos y crianza de ganado; el comprara insumos agrícolas (abonos, herbicidas, etc.) y una ternera para criarla y luego vendarla, con el préstamo anterior el pudo trabajar sin ningún problema, pues tenía a su alcance todo lo necesario para preparar la tierra, tuvo mejores ganancias, pago la deuda y mejoro las condiciones de vida que le daba a su familia. El sigue luchando por lograr cada día un negocio más rentable que le ayude a cumplir con los compromisos que tiene.
texts.en: Luis is asking for capital to invest in his basic grains growing and cattle raising business.  He will buy agricultural supplies (manure, herbicide, etc.) and a calf to raise to subsequently sell.  He was able to work with his previous loan with no problem for he had everything needed to work the land on-hand.  His profits were higher, he repaid the loan and he improved the living conditions he provided his family.  He continues striving to make his business more profitable every day that will help him meet the obligations he has.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and a calf.

loans.name: Julia Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Julia  es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y  humilde vive junto a su esposo e  hijos en una comunidad en la zona  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad.
Doña Julia necesita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería  como lociones,  perfumes, cremas,  talcos, desinfectantes, etc. producto que  necesita para seguir  vendiendo su  producto. Espera que gracias a esta inversión pueda contar con los productos  necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
Doña Julia espera que sus ventas tengan un aumento, el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de su familia.
Doña Julia su sueño es que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad  y  de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia e  hijos y que estos continúen con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre   del  2013
texts.en:
Julia is a hardworking, responsible, and modest person. She lives with her husband and children in a community in an area of Honduras. Her business is selling cosmetics and it is well known within her community.

Julia needs a loan in order to buy merchandise such as lotions, perfumes, creams, talcum powders, disinfectants, etc., supplies which she needs in order to continue selling her products. She hopes that thanks to this loan she will have the necessary products in order to continue with her business and thus meet the demand from her customers.

Julia hopes that her sales increase which she will see reflected in the quality of life for her family.

Julia’s dream is that her business continues growing and becomes better known in the community so that she will be able to continue supporting her family and children and she hopes that they continue their studies and have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy lotions, perfumes, creams, talcum powder, disinfectants, etc., for her business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, es una persona que ha trabajado con créditos anteriormente y ha visto que los resultados son: mejores ganancias, un negocio más amplio, más clientes. Por lo que en esta oportunidad nuevamente está dispuesta a invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas (insecticidas, herbicidas, abono) y un cerdo que engordara para luego venderlo. 
Dolores enfrento una dificultad en su salud, pero eso no le evito cumplir con el pago de su deuda, su familia sigue apoyándola en sus actividades, pues su producción aumento y necesita que le colaboren para  recoger la cosecha.
texts.en: Dolores is someone who has worked with loans previously and has seen the results: better profits, an expanded business, and more customers. This is why on this occasion, she is again disposed to purchase farm supplies (insecticides, herbicides, fertilizer) and a pig, which she will fatten and later sell. Dolores had a health problem, but this did not interfere with her paying off her loan. Her family continues to support her in her work. Her production increased and she needs their help to collect the harvest.

loans.use: compra de insumos agrícolas (insecticidas, herbicidas, abono) y un cerdo

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 38 years old and all of her children are in school.

Elizabeth has a buying and selling recycled materials business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more recycled materials for resale.

Elizabeth has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purhcase more recycled materials for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and shelving to store it.

loans.name: Maria Karen

texts.en:
Maria Karen is married, with one child.  

She runs a retail store as an aid to her husband's income from employment. Aside from this, she also sells food and snacks to earn a living. 

She joined GDMPC currently and has borrowed money to buy grocery goods to resell. 

She hopes to sustain her business to have daily income for their future needs. She wants to become successful in her business and able to provide the needs of her child in the future.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 37, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arceo and a mother to their children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Erlinda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Erlinda dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 40 years old and married, with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to pay laborers' salaries in land preparation for her next crop.

Cecilia has been farming rice for years, and she also earns income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salaries in land preparation for her next crop

loans.name: Mauricio Roye

texts.en:
Becoming an environmental engineer has always been Mauricio's dream. Mauricio is currently attending the Universidad Privada Domingo Savio Tarija, working towards his degree in environmental engineering. He plans on graduating in February, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

Mauricio plans on using the loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in environmental engineering before graduating. 

With a career in environmental engineering, he expects to earn $17 a day, a substantial increase from before. With two older siblings attending college already, Mauricio is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Marcelo Omar

texts.en:
Marcelo dreams of becoming a commercial engineer, but without a degree, he knows it may never be possible. Marcelo was accepted into the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, and now with the chance to achieve his dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. He plans on graduating in February, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

With a loan, Marcelo plans on using the funds to pay his graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Chuquisaca. Marcelo currently works 30 hours a week. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. 

With a degree in commercial engineering, he expects to earn $25 a day. With two younger brothers, Marcelo hopes to be a role model for his younger siblings by being the first in his family to graduate from university. Marcelo's father's salary is the family's primary source of income. For a family of five, finances have always been tight.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 62 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Natividad has a food vending business in the Philippines. Natividad requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Natividad has been in this business for twenty-five years. In the future, Natividad would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years old and has five children. Marilyn is married and has three children who are still in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for 6 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs
